description.narrative: Colombia has great potential for further economic growth and in order to capture this potential a good functioning logistical infrastructural system is vital. Although much is invested in seaports, the hinterland connections appear to be the limiting factor where congestion of road transport is causing major difficulties.An efficient, sustainable and multimodal transport system would help to further unlock economic potential in the country. In December 2014 a group of Colombians visited the Netherlands for an Exchange of Knowledge Program on Multimodal Transport. After this visit a desire was expressed to further continue this exchange of knowledge in the time to come and using problems that could be solved by using Dutch expertise. The assistance of Dutch officials and experts could further expose Colombian authorities to Dutch knowledge and solutions and eventually lead to opportunities for Dutch companies in projects resulting from among others the Intermodal Transport Master Plan and the Fluvial Master Plan. However as the Dutch sector often is successful because of integrated approaches, there is a desire to showcase such an approach in the Colombian context by addressing one of these issues in a Colombia Dutch Dialogue (CDD). The aim of this project is to further develop the exchange of knowledge on Multimodal Transport between Colombia and the Netherlands by having Dutch and Colombian experts working together on an actual case in Colombia.Strategic goals of a the CDD T&L include:- Learning from each other, the mutual exchange of knowledge about the size and scope of the problem and possible solutions.- Strengthening of cooperation and B2B networks.- Continuing building a long term (trust) relationship with the underlying goal of positioning the sector on a specific theme.Rijkswaterstaat Dienst Water, Verkeer en Leefomgeving has been commissioned to carry out this project.
